rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative adjective modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment uses factual language ('analyzing', 'work', 'added', 'pointing out', 'reported') without high-potency verbs or metaphors.
The segment reports testing and absence of previous cases, which is a bare negation/positive fact not an explicit calming cue.
Segment contains Q5 cue ('no confirmed cases'). Q6 is not applicable.
The segment contains the bare negation 'no confirmed cases... have ever been reported' without an explicit calming cue.
